name: OGS5-EGS
tagline: OGS5 branch for deep geothermal reservoir modeling
body:
### About
This website provides information about OGS5-EGS code. The code is a branch of OpenGeoSys (www.opengeosys.org) v5.3.3 for deep geothermal reservoir modeling developed by @norihiro-w. 

Please be aware that 
- The code is not fully compatible with the official version.
- Use of the official OGS version is recommended if your problem can work with it.

### Features
- Groundwater flow and heat transport modeling in porous media and discretely fractured porous media based on FEM
- Unstructured mesh with mixed dimensional elements
- Parallelization: OpenMP with Lis / MPI with PETSc

### Change logs
see [Release Note](https://github.com/norihiro-w/ogs5-egs/releases)

### Third-party libraries
The code uses the following external libraries
- [ExprtTk](http://www.partow.net/programming/exprtk/)
- [RapidXML](http://rapidxml.sourceforge.net/)
- [Lis](http://www.ssisc.org/lis/) (optional) *Latest Lis is not supported yet. please use [older one](http://www.ssisc.org/lis/dl/lis-1.2.70.tar.gz).
- [PETSc](https://www.mcs.anl.gov/petsc/) (optional)
- MKL (optional)

### How to compile
#### with Lis
1. Compile Lis
2. Download source codes from above links and extract it
3. Compile OGS as
```
cd [source-directory]
mkdir ../build
cd ../build
cmake ../[source-directory] -DOGS_FEM_LIS=ON -DLIS_INCLUDE_DIR=[lis include dir] -DLIS_INCLUDE_DIR=[lis include dir] -DLIS_LIBRARIES=[lis library path]
```

### Tutorials
Please note that some of the tutorials were prepared a few years ago and don't work as it is with the latest source code.
* Basics of heat transport modeling with OGS ([book](https://docs.opengeosys.org/books/geoenergy-modeling-i), [slides](https://github.com/norihiro-w/ogs5-egs/tree/gh-pages/docs/Slides_OGS_Geothermal_Basics.pdf))
* Flow and heat transport modeling in EGS reservoirs with porous media approach ([pdf](https://github.com/norihiro-w/ogs5-egs/tree/gh-pages/docs/Tutorial_EPM.pdf))
* Flow and heat transport modeling in EGS reservoirs with discrete fracture approach ([pdf](https://github.com/norihiro-w/ogs5-egs/tree/gh-pages/docs/Tutorial_DF.pdf)) 
* Meshing with Gina ([pdf](https://github.com/norihiro-w/ogs5-egs/tree/gh-pages/docs/Meshing_GINA_SingleFracture.pdf))
